archetype_name: Family Hands-Off Sheet Pan & Slow Cooker Nights
name: Slow Cooker Lemon-Oregano Whole Chicken with Potatoes & Olives
description: Set-and-forget Greek–Middle Eastern style whole chicken with tender potatoes and a bright lemon-olive finish. Optional quick oven blast crisps the skin before serving.
prep_steps: Scrub 1 kg potatoes and cut into 3–4 cm chunks.
Peel 2 onions and cut into thick wedges.
Rinse 4–5 carrots and cut into 3–4 cm pieces.
Zest and juice 1 lemon; cut the squeezed lemon into wedges.
Measure spices: 2 tsp oregano, 1.5 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper.
Measure liquids: 2 tbsp olive oil, 120 ml water.
Optional: Rinse 1 preserved lemon and chop the rind; drain 100 g olives.
cook_steps: Add potatoes, onions, and carrots to the slow cooker. Scatter half the garlic, half the oregano, and half the salt and pepper over the vegetables.
Stir together olive oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, remaining garlic, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Place whole chicken breast-side up on top of the vegetables. Pour the lemon-oil mixture over the chicken. Tuck lemon wedges around. Add water and 2 bay leaves.
Cover and cook on Low for 6–7 hours or on High for 3.5–4 hours, until chicken is cooked through and tender.
Optional crisp: Transfer chicken to a roasting tray and brush with some cooking juices; roast in a hot oven (220°C) for 8–10 minutes to crisp the skin.
Return chicken to the vegetables (remove bay leaves). Stir in olives and optional chopped preserved lemon rind. Rest 5 minutes.
Carve and serve chicken with the potatoes and vegetables, spooning over the lemony juices.
